info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 3:57AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected, with accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and winds gusting as high as 40 mph that could lead to blowing snow. * WHERE...Klamath Basin near Modoc Point and in eastern Klamath County and western Lake County along Winter Rim. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. And new snow may make travel on remote roads difficult. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
